snippet.title: Jaguar XF Sportbrake to pounce in November
snippet.content: POSH wagons continue to build momentum and Jaguar will be the latest manufacturer to deliver a load-lugger from November 1. Priced from $90,400, the Jaguar XF Sportbrake will be available with a choice of two diesel engines and one turbocharged petrol in R-Sport, S and First Edition specifications. The range starts with a rear-wheel drive 132kW diesel that has fuel consumption of 4.8litres/100km. The 2.0-litre four-cylinder petrol engine generates 184kW. At the other end of the performance spectrum, customers can choose the 221kW 3.0-litre V6 diesel engine. The Jaguar XF Sportbrake will arrive in Australia during November priced from $90,400. Paired with a ZF eight-speed automatic transmission, it can sprint from 0-100kmh in 6.6 seconds. Cargo space is 565 litres, which is bigger than a Ford Falcon but slightly smaller than the boot of a VW Passat, although drop the seats and there's an expansive 1700 litres. AT A GLANCE XF 18MY Sportbrake RRP R-Sport 20d 132kW (a)$90,400 R-Sport 25t 184kW (a) $91,400 S 30d 221kW (a)$123,450 First Edition 30d 221kW (a)$137,300
